references.reason: This paper introduces a method for creating a large dataset of formalized math statements, a crucial step in training advanced theorem-proving models.

references.paper_title: Deepseek-prover: Advancing theorem proving in LLMs through large-scale synthetic data
references.reason: This paper details the creation and use of a powerful open-source theorem prover that serves as a foundation for the current work.
This paper presents a method for automatically translating informal math statements into formal language, which is a key component of the dataset creation process.

references.paper_title: minif2f: a cross-system benchmark for formal olympiad-level mathematics
references.reason: This paper introduces a widely used benchmark dataset (miniF2F) for evaluating the performance of theorem provers, which is used for comparison in the current work.

references.paper_title: Putnambench: Evaluating neural theorem-provers on the putnam mathematical competition
references.reason: This paper introduces another important benchmark dataset (PutnamBench) used for evaluating and comparing theorem provers.
